DataElement.preferredName: Surgical Procedure Wound Infection Adverse Event Anatomic Site
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the anatomic site of an infection occurring in the wound from a surgical procedure as an unfavorable and unintended sign (including an abnormal laboratory finding), symptom, syndrome, or disease.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Surgical Procedure Wound Infection Adverse Event
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to infection occurring in the wound from a surgical procedure as an unfavorable and unintended sign (including an abnormal laboratory finding), symptom, syndrome, or disease.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Used for operative procedures on organs, regions, or tissues in the treatment of diseases, including tissue section by lasers. It excludes transplantation, for which "transplantation" is used.

Concepts.definition: A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.

Property.preferredDefinition: Infection occurring in the wound.:Any unfavorable and unintended sign (including an abnormal laboratory finding), symptom, syndrome, or disease, temporally associated with the use of a medical product or procedure, regardless of whether or not it is considered related to the product or procedure (attribution of unrelated, unlikely, possible, probable, or definite). The concept refers to events that could be medical product related, dose related, route related, patient related, caused by an interaction with another therapy or procedure, or caused by opioid initiation or dose escalation. The term also is referred to as an adverse experience. The old term Side Effect is retired and should not be used.

Concepts.definition: Infection of a break in the skin or other tissue.

Any unfavorable or unintended disease, sign, or symptom (including an abnormal laboratory finding) that is temporally associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure, and that may or may not be considered related to the medical treatment or procedure. Such events can be related to the intervention, dose, route of administration, patient, or caused by an interaction with another drug(s) or procedure(s).

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition:
any unfavorable symptoms, signs, or disease temporally associated with the use of a medical
treatment or procedure that may or may not be considered related to the medical
treatment or procedure.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the named locations of a wound infection within the body.

Concepts.definition: Of, or related to, the abdomen.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition:
any unfavorable symptoms, signs, or disease temporally associated with the use of a medical
treatment or procedure that may or may not be considered related to the medical
treatment or procedure.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Named locations of, or within, the body.

Concepts.definition: Named locations of or within the body.

DataElement.origin: NSABP CRF:National Surgical Adjuvant Breast and Bowel Project Case Report Form
